title.narrative: Basic Need Assistance to Conflict-Affected Households in Iraq

description.narrative:
Mercy Corps (MC) requests a €2M contribution from ECHO (79,52%) to support an estimated 4.680 conflict-affected households (HH)/ (28.080 individuals) with unconditional cash transfers through a flexible rapid response mechanism. To address immediate basic needs swiftly and effectively, MC will conduct emergency one-off unconditional cash transfers distributed to conflict affected HH, and a multi-month unconditional cash transfers distributed to extremely vulnerable conflict affected HH. The proposed intervention will build on MC's previously funded ECHO programme (€2.477.000, reference: ECHO/-ME/BUD/2014/91002) reaching 2,800 HH with multiple months of cash assistance. MC will work in hard-to-reach areas where continued displacements (or returns) are anticipated, including Diyala and Kirkuk Governorates. MC will also continue to work in Sulaymaniyah to serve vulnerable people living outside of camps. Activities will be supported by MC teams based in Sulaymaniyah and Kirkuk.
Following the outbreak of fighting in December 2013, armed conflict spread throughout Iraq, resulting in widespread displacement and humanitarian need on a massive scale. In January 2015, MC conducted a rapid assessment in four governorates through which vulnerable HH identified their priority needs as rent for shelter and food. Due to limited work opportunities, HH face an income gap of $334 --about half average total monthly expenditures-- resulting in increased borrowing and negative coping strategies such as restricted food consumption.

Overall objective: Newly displaced and conflict-affected households are able to meet their critical basic needs
Specific objective: To provide essential unconditional cash assistance to conflict-affected households
Expected Result 1: Emergency one-off unconditional cash transfers have been distributed to conflict-affected households
Expected Result 2: Multi-month unconditional cash transfers distributed to extremely vulnerable conflict-affected households
Beneficiaries: Conflict-affected households

participating-org.narrative: Directorate-General for European Civil Protection and Humanitarian Aid Operations (ECHO)
